citeinfo.title: Canopy Height Data

citeinfo.origin: Please refer to Dataset Point of Contact.
citeinfo.title: Please refer to the Projects table in the Landscape Data Commons database.

descript.abstract: Vegetation height is measured as the height of the tallest plant part within a 30 cm (12 in) diameter cylinder projected tangent to the transect. It is measured vertically from the soil surface at the center of the cylinder. References(s): Herrick, J.E., J. Van Zee, S.E. McCord, J.W. Karl, E. Courtright, and L. Burkett. 2018. The Monitoring Manual for Grassland, Shrubland, and Savanna Ecosystems. USDA-ARS.
descript.purpose: Vegetation height provides plot-level vertical structure information necessary to predict soil erosion from wind and characterize wildlife habitat. Vegetation height is usually measured at the same time as Line-point intercept because it is more efficient, but can be measured separately.

procstep.procdesc: Data gathered into a harmonized "tall" format using the terradactyl R package gather_height() function. https://github.com/Landscape-Data-Commons/terradactyl.
